meanings.definition: A photograph of a person's head.
meanings.sent1: I took a headshot for my new ID card.
meanings.sent2: The photographer captured a perfect headshot of the model.
meanings.sent3: The headshot on the wall made everyone laugh because of the funny expression.
meanings.sent4: Her headshot in the magazine was so striking, it caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The headshot in the frame looked so vivid, it felt like the person was right there.

meanings.definition: A shot that hits a target in the head.
meanings.sent1: The sniper's precise headshot took down the enemy instantly.
meanings.sent2: The video game character aimed for a headshot to defeat the final boss.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the hero always managed to get a headshot on the villain.
meanings.sent4: The headshot in the action scene was so realistic, it made everyone gasp.
meanings.sent5: The headshot in the target practice was so accurate, it impressed everyone at the range.

meanings.definition: A killing or disabling shot to the head.
meanings.sent1: The headshot ended the duel in a single fatal blow.
meanings.sent2: The detective knew the case was solved with just one headshot.
meanings.sent3: The headshot in the movie was so dramatic, it made the audience gasp.
meanings.sent4: The headshot in the story symbolized the ultimate defeat of the villain.
meanings.sent5: The headshot in the battle scene was so intense, it left everyone on the edge of their seats.
